result.execSummary:
The defendant Ramone L Malone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA surcharge; pay surcharge. Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges. The court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
CONSECUTIVE TO EACH OTHER AS TO BOTH COUNTS; and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence defendant is currently serving

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
- No Contact with the victim.
- Cooperate and participate with a Mental Health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
- Cooperate and participate with a Sex Offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
- Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramone L Malone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (17 pages) commencing 01/11/16 received and filed.

Clerk called court reporter to find out what the 11.3.15 plea transcript states.  Per the court reporter the Court found the defendant guilty of 3rd Degree sexual assault and False imprisonment as will be charged in the states amended information. State didn't have the amended information in court and was to sign and file the information on 11.3.15. Court will recall case to correct the record.

Defendant Ramone L Malone not in court, defendant in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO COURT FILE. Case called to correct 11.3.15 entry. Court accepts states filing of the amended information and enters a guilty pleas for the defendant.   Amended Information received and filed.  Court orders charges amended to Count 1:  3rd Degree Sexual Assault [a Class G FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.225(3). Count 2:  False Imprisonment [a Class H FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.30.

Defendant Ramone L Malone in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Ramone L Malone in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

COURT CLARIFIED THE RECORD:  Attorneys advised the Court that the defendant pled guilty to two amended charges on the Plea Hearing date before Judge McAdams' Court on 11-03-2015.  The court record does not reflect the same and furthermore, the Court does not have a transcript to review for verification purposes.  Court accepts the attorneys' representations that Judge McAdams did in fact accept State's motion to amend the original charge to two felony charges as follows:

Count 1:  3rd Degree Sexual Assault [a Class G FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.225(3).
Count 2:  False Imprisonment [a Class H FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.30.

**NO AMENDED INFORMATION WAS FILED ON 11-03-2015.
**NO ARRAIGNMENT HEARING HELD.

Sentencing proceeds. 
Statements made by the State and defense.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS, consecutive to Count #2, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS, consecutive to Count #1, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.    
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance  of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Attorney Marcella De Peters appeared TELEPHONICALLY on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant, Ramone L Malone not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

PER THE PERMISSION OF JUDGE DONALD AND HIS UNAVAILABILITY ON THE NEXT COURT DATE, CLERK ADJOURNED TOMORROW'S SENTENCING HEARING OFF THE RECORD.

Judge Donald is unavailable on 12-18-2015 in the morning.
Case adjourned to 01-11-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Ramone L Malone in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Ramone L Malone in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armour. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Ramone L Malone not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

PER THE PERMISSION OF JUDGE DONALD, CLERK ADJOURNED TODAY'S FINAL PRETRIAL CONFERENCE OFF THE RECORD.

Parties are close to a resolution, however, need more time to work out the details.
Parties request a Plea Hearing date one day this week.
Case adjourned to 11-03-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.
Final Pre-Trial on Monday, November 2, 2015 at 8:30 AM in BR 2, SB Rm 506 of the Circuit Court of MIlwaukee County.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Ramone L Malone not in court, in custody.  
Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final Pre-trial.  Defendant not produced for the purpose of todays proceedings.  Parties still engaged in negotiations.  Joint request for adjournment granted; date selected  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed.
Defendant's Motion in Limine, filed.
OCTOBER 21, 2015 at 8:30 AM in BR 2, Rm 506 of the CIRCUIT COURT of MILWAUKEE COUNTY.
Clerk left defense counsel a voicemail informing her that the Notice she filed in branch 7 should be filed in branch 2 as that is the assigned court for this case.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Ramone L Malone not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties awaiting the crime lab results.
Parties request a Jury Trial date.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 10-21-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 11-16-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Ramone L Malone not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State advises the Court the Crime Lab has not received the bucal swabs yet.

Per Chief Judge Directive of 15-10, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Branch 02, Judge Joseph Donald, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Ramone L Malone not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State is still awaiting the DNA results.  Parties move for an adjournment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Ramone L Malone not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
INFORMATION DOCUMENT, RECEIVED AND FILED

Defendant Ramone L Malone in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Ramone L Malone in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Geri Lin Dunn-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling Conference on May 28, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court  proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Courtney B or her family/school/home/work

Defendant Ramone L Malone in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Ramone L Malone in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
OTP
